citation.article-title: Leifsonia kribbensis sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Leifsonia kribbensis sp. nov.

Leifsonia kribbensis (kri.bben′sis. N.L. fem. adj. kribbensis pertaining to KRIBB, an arbitrary adjective formed from the acronym of the Korea Research Institute of Bioscience and Biotechnology, where taxonomic studies on the type strain were performed).
Gram-positive, non-acid-fast and aerobic.
Forms yellow-coloured, circular, small, glistening, opaque colonies with an entire margin on diluted R2A medium.
Colonies are 0.6–1.8 mm in diameter.
Cells are rods, 0.6–1.3 μm wide by 0.9–1.3 μm long, occurring singly or in pairs.
Does not form endospores.
Aerial mycelium is not observed.
Catalase- and oxidase-negative.
Tolerates up to 3.0 % NaCl and grows at temperatures between 20 and 37 °C, with optimum growth at 28 °C.
Growth occurs between pH 6.0 and 11.0, with optimum growth at pH 8.0.
Positive for decomposition of casein, starch, Tween 80 and tyrosine.
Negative for degradation of cellulose, elastin, gelatin, pectin and xylan, growth in the presence of phenol (0.3 %) and reduction of nitrate.
Acid is weakly produced from l-rhamnose and sucrose.
Utilization of various carbon sources is detailed in Table 1.
The diagnostic cell-wall diamino acid is diaminobutyric acid.
Cell-wall sugars are glucose, rhamnose, ribose and galactose.
Phospholipids detected are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol and several unidentified lipids.
Major fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 1ω9c, iso-C14 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C17 : 0.
The major menaquinones are MK-12 and MK-11.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 73.4 mol%.
Physiological and biochemical properties of strain MSL-13T that differentiate it from its closest phylogenetic neighbours in the genus Leifsonia
Strains: 1, MSL-13T; 2, L. poae DSM 15202T; 3, L. shinshuensis JCM 10591T; 4, L. naganoensis JCM 10592T; 5, L. aquatica DSM 20146T; 6, L. bigeumensis DSM 19322T; 7, L. ginsengi JCM 13908T.

Data for reference type strains are from Davis et al. (1984), Suzuki et al. (1999), Evtushenko et al. (2000), Reddy et al. (2003) and Qiu et al. (2007). +, Positive; −, negative; w, weakly positive; na, data not available.
All strains are positive for utilization of d-mannitol.
The type strain, MSL-13T (=KCTC 19267T =DSM 19272T), was isolated from soil on Bigeum Island, Republic of Korea.
